message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.ST

Reasoning: The paper introduces and analyses an algorithm for stochastic bandits, which is a common problem in machine learning and optimization. The use of subgaussian noise suggests a focus on statistical learning theory, which is often associated with the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). The algorithm is designed to minimise cumulative regret, which is a common performance metric in bandit problems, suggesting a focus on algorithms and optimization, which are often associated with the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also provides finite-time regret guarantees, which suggests a focus on information theory and analysis, which are often associated with the sub-category cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.ST (Statistics Theory).
